meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mutable.
meanings.sent1: The mutabilities of the weather make it unpredictable.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the mutabilities of different substances.
meanings.sent3: The mutabilities of the chameleon's skin color amazed the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings were like the mutabilities of a pendulum, constantly shifting.
meanings.sent5: The mutabilities of the river's flow were mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: The ability to change or be changed.
meanings.sent1: The mutabilities of technology have transformed our daily lives.
meanings.sent2: Adapting to the mutabilities of the market is crucial for business success.
meanings.sent3: The mutabilities of the caterpillar into a butterfly are truly remarkable.
meanings.sent4: His perspective on life shifted with the mutabilities of experience.
meanings.sent5: The mutabilities of the seasons bring a sense of renewal each year.
